pros: The Mission is everything...addressing health equity and training (black and brown) future healthcare professionals. The students are amazing. Most of the staff is hardworking and inclusive.
cons: Where to start. The treatment of staff does NOT line up with the mission. Just treat your staff right. Beating them down every chance you get is not healthy nor effective. There is a lot of lying and intentional lack of communication towards the staff, who give their all each and every day. Leadership is not consistent. They are big on their titles and the average person's opinion does not matter (it is not even heard to possibly take into consideration). Turn over is high and has been for years. We wonder why the Board does not question this. It's all about bringing in money and the principles of proper philanthropy are not followed. Faculty are AMAZING and are leaving for not only better opportunities but because they are tired of constant brow-beating.

pros: Allowed to be creative and learn how grow into my position. Great work place.

pros: Great place to work. Faculty, staff, administration, and clinical experience are amazing. You will be supported and acknowledged for new ideas that the institution can employ.
cons: If you don't want to wear a mask or do weekly covid-19 tests, then do not apply. If you are not vaccinated, you will not be considered. This is a medical school and they are serious about the safety of all their employees and students. This can be a pro or a con. For me, it was a pro, because I do wear a mask and did the vaccine. I want my family and my coworkers to be safe and well.

pros: Technically astute staff who stay under the 'politics radar' can obtain a variety of skills and grow their career.  Depending on the department you're in, travel (domestic and international) and professional development opportunities are plentiful.  Health and wellness program (i.e., onsite gym, classes) is a huge perk and encouraged.  Small campus allows for camaraderie and team building among faculty, staff, and students.  Nurturing faculty and staff are committed and care deeply about the success of students.
cons: History of lack luster fundraising efforts combined with federal sequestration (budget cuts) impedes progress and will eventually force the institution to close its doors, or, merge with one of Georgia's larger academic medical centers. Tolerance for nepotism at the executive level reinforces an unethical work environment. Extremely demanding workloads coupled with recent mass layoffs wreaks havoc on employee morale and threatens the quality of work performance.

pros: There are no pros because this place is unprofessional.
cons: Volatile work environment and no room for growth.

pros: Great place to work and great atmosphere
cons: Covid affecting face to face learning/teaching

review_title: Amazing Institution, Challenging (In All the Wrong Ways) Company to Work For
job_title: Administrative Assistant I in Atlanta, GA
pros: There is a strong personal/familial environment within departments (less so across the institution/inter-departmentally) that contributes to the camaraderie necessary for great teamwork and shared mental models. Most staff and faculty are truly dedicated to the institution's mission and this mission is communicated often by institutional leadership.  There is definitely a feeling of being part of "something bigger" than yourself given that MSM is one of very few HBCU's that educates and trains a large number of black/brown physicians.
cons: There is a major lack of standardized processes and operating procedures that makes daily workflow feel very chaotic, unproductive, and stressful. Training opportunities for staff and for managers in particular is spotty, which adds to the feeling of disorganized chaos. Feedback is not provided by direct supervisors often enough, again probably due to a lack of standard operating procedures to compare your performance to. Follow up with process improvement does not occur, so the concept of "continuous" improvement is not achieved.

review_title: Low morale, pay scale is below average, good for professional development.
pros: Knowledge and community involvement.  Flexibility.  Little to no micromanaging. Making friendships and good working relationships. Goal oriented atmosphere.
cons: Pay is not competitive, lots of animosity, an "all about who you know" type of promotion strategy, poor leadership, supervisor to staff relationship is built around intimidation and authority.  It's a HBCU that employees (non-black) people that barely even speaks to you.

pros: Flexibility  (depending on your dept)
cons: LOW employee morale. Seems that all "staff" employees have several things in common; they agree that leadership doesn't care about employees unless you have an M.D. or Ph.D; they agree that supervisors, especially those in leadership, are VERY disrespectful & could benefit from extensive training in people skills; agree that leadership positions are over-paid and that staff are extremely under-paid; agree that morale is low; and agree that is obvious and evident that leadership doesn't care

review_title: Morehouse School of Medicine Lacks of Ethical Standards
pros: Young inexperience workers can obtain work experience.  Paid sick leave and vacation is adequate.
cons: Nepotism. The organization is small and poorly managed.  Family and friends are hired that are not qualified for the position and given top dollar salaries. Qualified workers are  given the low-end salary and  do not receive raises. No confidence in Sr. Management and the school is on the verge of losing accreditation. The school will probably not be around within the next 10 years.

review_title: Higher Management Should Be Held Accountable For Their Performance
pros: Those not in administrative positions are great to work with.
cons: Workplace bullying is not addressed. Personal vendettas towards those who don't measure up to "perceived standards" not addressed. Directors and Program Directors protect one another by not holding themselves accountable by how they treat those working under them allowing too much power to ruin a life. Upper mobility is blocked.

pros: Some of people that you meet at this organization become like family. This helps to keep a positive environment in some of the most toxic situations.
cons: No growth opportunities within the departments. Your job description changes ALOT but you do not receive additional pay or raises. There isn't room for work life balance for exempt employees.

review_title: one of the greatest experiences of my life
pros: intellectually stimulating, student body was a pleasure to work with, watch them develop and 4 years later...another M.D. in the larger community. Colleagues were great to work with...as in life..both joy and sometimes not ...overall a great place to not only work but to grow as a human being.,
cons: sorry...I enjoyed my role at the medical school and was pleased to have been part of the growth of the institution..no cons...

job_title: Administrative Assistant III in Atlanta, GA
pros: Faculty love their students and there are some great employees. Students are the highlight of the school. They are so thankful and happy to be MSM students.
cons: The executive leadership is terrible! Mismanagement of money. Top heavy salaries. Current President is "the 2 faces of eve". I hoped a woman would act and interact different then she does. I believe in the school, but leadership mistreats the employees. Employer bullying does exist!

review_title: Great place to enhance skills but advancement  opportunities are lacking
pros: This is  a great place to start your career and  build skills.  There has been a few changes for the better such has 2 or 3% pay increase but it still does not measure up to industry standards.
cons: Low pay, No Tuition Assistance, Cafeteria food is terrible, Silos exist, and employees have low morale.

review_title: Definitely NOT a good company to work for!
pros: I honestly cannot think of one pro besides I guess it pays the bills (for the most part)
cons: Poor leadership, low employee morale, high turnover rate, benefits are not competitive, salaries are not competitive, lack of incentives

pros: Research and study without teaching classes.  Historic school with family atmosphere. Tutoring of newer graduate students for extra income. They care about their students.
cons: Small school that has a fairly new Graduate education of biomedical science.  Only a downside if you enjoy hiding in a crowd!

review_title: The overall experience was great, but resources were not in place

cons: Resources need improvement, processes needs improvement, needs better communication school wide, handbook needed to refer policy school wide. Better salary range and increases.

review_title: It is the worst place I have ever worked!

cons: This place is in a cultural crisis!  President is self servicing, horrible to everyone closest to her, breaks you down to lift herself up!
